featured.text: The economic crisis may have also played a role: Homeowners who were not able to pay their bank loans were forced to abandon their properties, sometimes leaving behind swimming pools that made excellent mosquito breeding grounds.
Most people who contract West Nile do not experience any symptoms at all, but, if they do, symptoms typically develop between 3 to 14 days after a mosquito bite.
the purchase of family-sized insecticide-treated mosquito nets costing $5 each.
Dallas County was not doing some of the key things to slow the spread of West Nile, such as testing dead birds and setting mosquito traps to test for the presence of the disease.
An extremely mild winter allowed more mosquitoes than usual to survive, while the unusually high temperatures in that scorching summer further increased their number by speeding up their life cycle.

other.text: The city declared a state of emergency and began aerial spraying of a pesticide to kill the mosquitoes, even though residents argued that the pesticide could be more dangerous than the disease.
Why was the summer of 2012 so hospitable to the West Nile virus and the mosquitoes that carry it?

definition.zh_def: 蚊子是一種小型的飛行昆蟲，通常以吸食動物或人類的血液為生。
definition.en_def: A mosquito is a small flying insect that typically feeds on the blood of animals or humans.
definition.example: I always use insect repellent to avoid mosquito bites during the summer.
